L2_gloss:
(intransitive) to die
Icham. ― He/she died.
Mu me jk'an xicham. ― I do not want to die.[1]
Synonyms: chʼay, chʼay ikʼ, laj, olan

(transitive) to want
Mu me jk'an xicham.[1]
I do not want to die.

as, like
ko'ol k'ucha'al... - same as...

same, similar
ko'ol k'ucha'al... - same as...

any types of animals except for human being
jkot chij / chon / mut - a sheep / snake / bird

(intransitive) to talk, to speak
kʼopoj ta batsʼi kʼopto speak in Tzotzil
(negation) not, Mu jna'. ― I do not know him/her/it.
(negation) not, Mu jna'. ― I do not know him/her/it.

big, large
jpets mukʼta teʼa big tree

(intransitive) to climb
muy ta teʼ / vitsto climb (a) tree / mountain

(transitive) to know
Mu jna. ― I don't know.

deep
ti nat uk'ume ― the deep stream

(intransitive) to come
¿Bu likemot tal?Where do you come from?(literally, “Where have you come?”)

tree
jpets te' ― a tree
muy ta te' ― to climb a tree

(intransitive) to fear
mu xaxiʼ ― don't be afraid
